arts.ttl: Mark Robins heaps praise on Lewis Baker after one of best ever Stoke City goals
arts.sum: Mark Robins spoke of the euphoria in the bet365 Stadium as Lewis Baker scored one of the best ever Stoke City goals to seal a vital win. "The third one is just out of this world, one of the best goals this stadium will have ever seen.

arts.ttl: Swansea City's woes continue after letting lead slip against Stoke City
arts.sum: Luke Williams ended up empty-handed in the Potteries, losing to fellow Championship strugglers Stoke

arts.ttl: Stoke player ratings vs Swansea as outrageous Lewis Baker goal seals vital win
arts.sum: Stoke were ready to defend through the closing stages but Baker put the finishing touches to a massive afternoon with a stunning goal, spotting Lawrence Vigouroux not even that far off his line and walloping it in from 60 yards. Stoke were behind on the hour mark when Cullen’s pass to Tymon should have been easily mopped up by Ashley Phillips or Johansson – but Phillips ended up poking the ball into the keeper instead and it fell free for Tymon to almost look embarrassed to tap in.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins seals first home win as Stoke boss in comeback victory over Swansea
arts.sum: Josh Tymon gave the visitors the lead after 61 minutes, but goals from Wouter Burger, Bae Jun-ho and Lewis Baker sealed the much-needed three points.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs Swansea as Ben Pearson makes first start in 11 months
arts.sum: Viktor Johansson takes the captain's armband while Lewis Baker, Tatsuki Seko, Ben Gibson, Josh Wilson-Esbrand and Nathan Lowe drop to the bench. Jordan Thompson is also back from a hernia operation to make his first start since October while Junior Tchamadeu, Lewis Koumas and Bae Junho are back in the starting XI after being used from the bench in mid-week at Bristol City.

arts.ttl: Stoke City vs Swansea live - Team news from bet365 Stadium - Stoke-on-Trent Live
arts.sum: Lewis Baker is heading into his 100th Stoke appearance and his side are looking for a fourth home clean sheet in the league in a row for what would be the first time since November 2012. Hello from the bet365 Stadium as Stoke City return home to take on Swansea in the Championship.

arts.ttl: What Mark Robins is doing on training pitch to help Stoke City prospect
arts.sum: “It’s things I try to take in and work on in training session to come, nothing monumental but little bits that I can tell are really going to help me as a player.” “I’d like to think that I’ve impressed him enough to stay around it and he’s always said to me that it’s down to performances whether you’re in the team or not.

arts.ttl: Challenge set out for Stoke City senior man after January loan decision
arts.sum: Lewis Baker will go into his 100th appearance for Stoke City today – and the 300th of his senior career – with his manager knowing he has the talent to seriously impact matches and trying to find a way to get him doing on a more regular basis. I noticed that in him the other night where he’s sort of not quite the Lewis we know and want to see on every occasion we see him play.

arts.ttl: How I want Stoke City to set up every week under Mark Robins
arts.sum: I want to watch at Stoke City side where the best players are picked in their number one positions, in a system that suits the squad, which is balanced and that we stick with match in, match out. Don’t think too much about squad rotation – or you certainly shouldn’t have to if the players are as fit as they should be – and just pick your best side.

arts.ttl: Stoke predicted starting XI vs Swansea as Mark Robins weighs up midfield dilemma
arts.sum: Lewis Baker, Seko, Andrew Moran, fit-again Jordan Thompson and Ben Pearson and Bosun Lawal - who are both returning from long-term injuries - are the manager's options. Stoke predicted starting XI vs Swansea: Johansson, Tchamadeu, Wilson-Esbrand, Phillips, Rose, Burger, Baker, Koumas, Junho, Al-Hamadi, Lowe.
